alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 9:49AM CDT until April 14 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flint Creek threatens individual campsites and becomes dangerous for recreational floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.4 feet this evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
